intro: Hieracium praecox var. ajmasianum, commonly known as the Ajmasian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late spring to early summer, forming small, daisy-like clusters. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
